text: COS3711 – October/November 2016 Page 1 of 2 1.1 The use of the writeToXml() function which is included in the GUI section of the class is the example of an antipattern design 1.2 2.1 class Book : public QObject { Q_OBJECT Q_PROPERTY(QString title READ getTitle WRITE setTitle) public: Book(); QString getTitle() const; void setTitle(QString t); private: QString title; }; class Fiction: public Book { Q_OBJECT Q_PROPERTY(QString genre READ getGenre WRITE setGenre) public: Fiction(); QString getGenre() const; void setGenre(QString g); private: QString genre; }; class NonFiction: public Book { Q_OBJECT Q_PROPERTY(QString subject READ getSubject WRITE setSubject) COS3711 – October/November 2016 Page 2 of 2 public: NonFiction(); QString getSubject() const; void setSubject(QString g); private: QString subject; };
